Title: Israel and Hamas Each Claim Wins in Fierce Fighting in Northern Gaza
Description: As the renewed clashes in the north of the enclave neared the three-month mark, there was no sign of them abating.

Title: For South Korean Families, a Grim Wait for Bodies After Plane Crash
Description: Officials said it could take up to 10 days to prepare the dead for transport, with the uncertainty adding to the shock and grief of relatives packed into an airport hall.

Title: Trinidad and Tobago Declares State of Emergency Over Rising Crime
Description: To curb gang killings and a rise in homicides, the measure empowers the military to make arrests and allows the authorities to enter suspects’ homes without warrants and deny them bail.

Title: Lebanon’s Economy Reels From War: ‘We Are Starting From Zero’
Description:
The conflict between Israel and Hezbollah may be suspended, but the damage is immense.
“We came out of this war with nothing,” one man said.

Title: Where Is Russia Finding New Soldiers? Wherever It Can.
Description: From murder suspects to immigrants to a former Olympic gold medalist, Russia pressures those it thinks should fight in Ukraine.

Title: The Rivers Run Dry and the Lights Go Out: A Warming Nation’s Doom Loop
Description:
An extraordinary drought has drained Ecuador’s rivers and reservoirs, leading to power outages of up to 14 hours.
Some fear this is the beginning of a larger global crisis.

Title: 5 Babies Die From the Cold in Gaza as Temperatures Drop
Description:
A boy less than three weeks old was among the latest to succumb to winter weather, Gazan officials said.
Families displaced by Israel’s attacks have little more than tents and tarps to protect them.

Title: From Bird Strike to Crash: the Mystery of the Korean Plane’s Four Fateful Minutes
Description: The time between when the pilot reported a bird strike and when it crashed could be key to unraveling one of the world’s worst aviation disasters in years.

Title: Appeals Are Filed in Mass Rape Case in France, Bringing New Trial for 17 Men
Description:
Dominique Pelicot, the man convicted of raping his wife and of inviting dozens of others to join him in the abuse, did not appeal.
But 17 of the other 50 found guilty did.

Title: Syria’s Rebel Leader Offers Hint of Timetable for Potential Elections
Description: Ahmed al-Shara, who led the rebel offensive that toppled Bashar al-Assad, offered little clarity on what the electoral process might look like.

Title: Russia and Ukraine Swap More Than 300 Prisoners Ahead of U.S. Transition
Description: Exchanges have taken place before, but this deal, involving big numbers on both sides, comes as Trump prepares to take over in Washington, potentially endangering American aid to Kyiv.

Title: Behind the Dismantling of Hezbollah: Decades of Israeli Intelligence
Description: A Times investigation shows how extensively Israel penetrated the Lebanese militia, closely tracking the group’s commanders and culminating in the assassination of its leader, Hassan Nasrallah.

Title: ‘This Is What Makes Us Rich’: Inside a Sinaloa Cartel Fentanyl Lab
Description: New York Times reporters witnessed the dangerous fentanyl production process inside a secret lab in Culiacán run by Mexico’s most powerful criminal syndicate.

Title: A Year Both Brutal and Bright: 13 Favorite Dispatches From 2024
Description:
In a year marked by wars, extreme weather and general wickedness, many dispatches defaulted to a distinctly dark tone.
But as our correspondents traversed the globe, they found pockets of light, too.

Title: Migrants Accused of Killing Mexican Immigration Agent
Description:
Officials said the agent was attacked by a group of migrants at a checkpoint in the northern state of Chihuahua after asking to see their identification papers.
At least two migrants were arrested.

Title: South Korea Clears Way to Detain President in Martial Law Inquiry
Description: The police are investigating whether President Yoon Suk Yeol tried to lead an insurrection when he declared martial law and plunged the country into crisis.

Title: Tuesday Briefing: Remembering Jimmy Carter
Description: Plus, the best of 2024.

Title: China Hacked Treasury Dept. in ‘Major’ Breach, U.S. Says
Description: The episode comes at a particularly sensitive moment, just as the Biden White House is dealing with one of the most far-reaching, and damaging, hacks into American infrastructure in the cyberage.

Title: Biden Announces $2.5 Billion in Security Aid to Ukraine
Description: The Treasury Department also released an additional $3.4 billion in budget aid as the Biden administration rushes assistance to Kyiv in its final weeks in office.

Title: Jimmy Carter’s Quiet but Monumental Work in Global Health
Description: In his decades as a former president, he and his wife, Rosalynn Carter, helped bring lifesaving treatments and sanitation to poor people around the world.

Title: Monday Briefing
Description: Jimmy Carter dies at 100.

Title: Jimmy Carter, Peacemaking President Amid Crises, Is Dead at 100
Description: Rising from Georgia farmland to the White House, he oversaw the historic Camp David peace accords, but his one-term presidency was waylaid by troubles at home and abroad.

Title: Video Offers Clues to Cause of Plane Crash, but No Immediate Answers
Description: The cause of the crash probably won’t be determined for months, with investigators expected to focus on a wide range of issues.

Title: Monday Briefing: A Plane Crash in South Korea killed 179
Description: Plus, Falun Gong’s money engine.

Title: Bird Strikes Are a Common Problem for Flights
Description: It is not uncommon for planes to strike wildlife, but most episodes don’t result in deaths or serious injuries.

Title: Amid Anti-Western Drift, Georgia Inaugurates a Conservative President
Description: Even though a figurehead, Mikheil Kavelashvili occupies a symbolic role as the country moves further from the West and toward Russia and China.

Title: Israel Struggles to Halt Attacks From Faraway Foe Once Off Radar
Description: Even as battles with its enemies on its borders appear to be winding down, Israel is being challenged by intensifying attacks by the Houthi militia in Yemen, 1,000 miles away.

Title: Azerbaijan Blames Russia for Plane Crash and Rebukes Kremlin
Description: The leader of Azerbaijan criticized the Russian response to the crash of a passenger jet that Azerbaijani officials said had most likely been hit by Russian air defenses.

Title: Anger and Agony in South Korea After Plane Crash-Lands, Killing 179
Description:
A Jeju Air passenger jet carrying 181 people from Bangkok sped off the runway and burst into flames.
Two crew were rescued in what was the country’s worst air disaster in decades.

Title: What to Know About South Korea’s Worst Plane Crash in Decades
Description:
A plane carrying 181 people crashed while landing, killing most on board.
Officials were investigating a possible malfunction with the landing gear and a bird strike.

Title: Boeing 737-800, a Precursor to the 737 Max, Is Used Widely.
Description: Nearly 200 airlines use the 737-800, which makes up about 15 percent of the world’s fleet of aircraft.

Title: Ignoring Warnings, a Growing Band of Tourists Venture to Afghanistan
Description: With the war now over, the Taliban are welcoming foreign travelers, even as governments advise their citizens to stay away.

Title: Despite Attacks, an Underground Church for L.G.B.T.Q. Africans Thrives
Description: The congregation in Nairobi, Kenya, has been forced to move to 10 different locations over 10 years, and yet it has survived as a sanctuary in an increasingly hostile environment.

Title: South Korea’s Acting President Has Been in Office Only Since Friday
Description: After two impeachments of leaders in two weeks, the country is deep into a political crisis.

Title: Netanyahu to Have Prostate Removal Surgery on Sunday
Description: The prime minister was diagnosed with an infection from a “benign enlargement of his prostate.”

Title: Musk Doubles Down on Support for German Far-Right Party
Description:
The world’s richest man, a key adviser to President-elect Donald J.
Trump, ridicules critics over his backing of the German extremist party AfD, as Germany prepares for elections.

Title: Shigeko Sasamori, Hiroshima Survivor Who Preached Peace, Dies at 92
Description: Severely disfigured when the United States dropped an atomic bomb on Japan, she spent her life warning others about the dangers of nuclear war.
